name: Zaratan
resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.Earth-Shaking Movement: As a bonus action after moving at least 10 feet on the ground, the zaratan can send a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must succeed on a DC 25+1d14 + 18 Constitution saving throw or the creature's concentration is broken.
traits.Legendary Resistance (3/Day): If the zaratan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
traits.Magic Weapons: The zaratan's weapon attacks are magical.
traits.Siege Monster: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

actions.Multiattack: The zaratan makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stomp.
actions.Bite: Melee Weapon Attack: +17+1d14 + 10 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) piercing damage.
actions.Stomp: Melee Weapon Attack: +17+1d14 + 10 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage.
actions.Spit Rock: Ranged Weapon Attack: +17+1d14 + 10 to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (6d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage.
actions.Spew Debris (Recharge 5xe2x80x936): The zaratan exhales rocky debris in a 90-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a DC 25+1d14 + 18 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is knocked prone.

options.Stomp: The zaratan makes one stomp attack.
options.Move: The zaratan moves up to its speed.
options.Retract (Costs 2 Actions): The zaratan retracts into its shell. Until it takes its Emerge action, it has resistance to all damage, and it is restrained. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Revitalize or Emerge action.
options.Revitalize (Costs 2 Actions): The zaratan can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell. It regains 52 (5d20) hit points. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Emerge action.
options.Emerge (Costs 2 Actions): The zaratan emerges from its shell and uses Spit Rock. It can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell.
